title: (x) Looking for a fun, energetic freeware font - various {gang}
author: missgiggles

comments.content:
I'd also like to know what font it is on the Mango and Cranberry loaf on the following link if possible or any other font similar. Thank you.  
 [http://www.warburtons.co.uk/our\_products/new.html#mango](http://web.archive.org/web/20100908074039/http:/www.warburtons.co.uk/our_products/new.html#mango "http://www.warburtons.co.uk/our\_products/new.html#mango")

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100908074039im_/http:/typophile.com/files/warbutons_5748.png)

not sure about the script on the bread packaging but [Wendy](http://web.archive.org/web/20100908074039/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&startrow=1&records=&currpage=1&totalrecords=3&displayfontid=LP.100007.0.0&fontRendererText=Fun+%26+Energetic) and [League Night](http://web.archive.org/web/20100908074039/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=7&subpage=viewfonts) are a couple good script choices.

I really want it to work on this magazine advert i have produced but not sure.  
 [http://typophile.com/node/32376](http://web.archive.org/web/20100908074039/http:/typophile.com/node/32376 "http://typophile.com/node/32376")

Do you think i should go for the script choices you have given above? or something like  
 [http://www.dafont.com/rhino.font?text=PLAY+ON%21+where+ever+you+are](http://web.archive.org/web/20100908074039/http:/www.dafont.com/rhino.font?text=PLAY+ON%21+where+ever+you+are "http://www.dafont.com/rhino.font?text=PLAY+ON%21+where+ever+you+are")

[http://www.dafont.com/search.php?text=PLAY+ON%21+where+ever+you+are&psiz...](http://web.archive.org/web/20100908074039/http:/www.dafont.com/search.php?text=PLAY+ON%21+where+ever+you+are&psize=m&q=heartbreaker "http://www.dafont.com/search.php?text=PLAY+ON%21+where+ever+you+are&psize=m&q=heartbreaker")

[http://www.dafont.com/search.php?text=PLAY+ON%21+where+ever+you+are&psiz...](http://web.archive.org/web/20100908074039/http:/www.dafont.com/search.php?text=PLAY+ON%21+where+ever+you+are&psize=m&q=thickhead "http://www.dafont.com/search.php?text=PLAY+ON%21+where+ever+you+are&psize=m&q=thickhead")

Or should I stick to Chlorine that i have used on my magazine advert on the above link? Thanks.
ooops they won't come up as hyperlinks. Sorry.
The black feels really heavy to me. Not "fun and energetic." Do you have any alternate layouts you're working on?

...Iâ€™d also like to know what font it is on the Mango and Cranberry loaf

take a look of [Candy Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20100908074039/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000254)

Ken, unfortunately not but I thought the green, florescent PLAY button would stand out on black. It would attract the target audience too (age 16-24 yr olds). It also depicts the idea of a night out i.e. disco lights in a club in the dark etc.

Alepaul, do you not think that Candy Script would be too heavy for bodycopy? I also can't afford to buy fonts at this stage so I have to stick with websites such as [www.dafont.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20100908074039/http:/www.dafont.com/ "www.dafont.com") unfortunately. Do you think that the nearest to the type on the fruit loaf packaging is:

[http://www.dafont.com/thickhead.font?text=PLAY+ON%21+where+ever+you+are](http://web.archive.org/web/20100908074039/http:/www.dafont.com/thickhead.font?text=PLAY+ON%21+where+ever+you+are "http://www.dafont.com/thickhead.font?text=PLAY+ON%21+where+ever+you+are")  
OR  
 [http://www.dafont.com/search.php?text=PLAY+ON%21+where+ever+you+are&psiz...](http://web.archive.org/web/20100908074039/http:/www.dafont.com/search.php?text=PLAY+ON%21+where+ever+you+are&psize=m&q=heart+breaker "http://www.dafont.com/search.php?text=PLAY+ON%21+where+ever+you+are&psize=m&q=heart+breaker")

Candyscript looks pretty damn nice to me for the headline. I like it much better than what ever the "Too fruity..." font is.

ChrisL
I didn't say I didn't like it. It's lovely but I would have to buy it and I cant afford to at this moment.

BoyzRGross\*  
Elroy  
Fenarrio\*  
GirlsAreWierd\*  
Heatwave  
MoFunky Fresh  
Paisley Two (Alternate)  
Party  
Planet Benson\*  
Postino  
Ravie\*  
Remedy  
Spumoni

Google: font fontname  
\* = free
giggles - I think you'll find that a post on the dafont forums will yield better results if you're only looking for free stuff. The members here are more familiar with commercial libraries.

Giggles -- I'd like to add that it would be better if you say upfront that you're looking for freeware stuff. Some of our identifiers might be -- maybe justly so -- iffed when they find out they've been hunting high and low to help you get a free lunch.\*

\* I've tried and tried to make this sound less harsh, but I must humbly confess that my English is failing me a bit right now. I sincerely hope you're not offended.

Yves, your English looks perfectly clear and unoffensive to me (as well as spot on).

ChrisL
